channel.title: [SUGGESTIONS] How could I improve this template?
channel.description:
Hey guys, I've been working on this template.. I like the layout, just how could I make it not so bland? I'm not sure what to add or take away.. Any suggestions?
[img]http://img10.imageshack.us/img10/2360/8wid.png[/img]
~Zeanr

item.title: [SUGGESTIONS] How could I improve this template?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

make the footer stretch the whole length of the page.

Read full topic
item.source: [SUGGESTIONS] How could I improve this template?

item.title: [SUGGESTIONS] How could I improve this template?
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

That bright blue highlight for the menu items contrast the black too much. (Try #0080aa) I feel it takes away from the main body of the website.

Maybe give the posts under the slider a border? (Something like border:1px solid #003344; with a border-radius:3px;) They look sort of like ads at the moment.

I’d also enlarge the header at the top.

Also, maybe give the body a background-color of #f1f1f1 and the main body a background of #f2f2f2? I think this will help the eyes focus in on the main content.

Read full topic
item.source: [SUGGESTIONS] How could I improve this template?

item.title: [SUGGESTIONS] How could I improve this template?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

I’d say the content and needs a slightly darker, more grey/white background. In some cases people most likely use the “wrapper” technique in CSS to keep everything inline and under that goes the logo, nav bar, content etc. But yeah that then maybe a striped background would go good. http://www.stripegenerator.com/

Read full topic

item.title: [SUGGESTIONS] How could I improve this template?
item.dc:creator: @Zeanr Zeanr
item.description:
@Zeanr wrote:

KempiScape:

add a cool background

I don’t think a background would go very well with this… I’ll see what I can do.

KempiScape:

or put this at the first line of the template, <?php die; ?>

Why would I do that? Do you not like the template or something?.. Because that would make no one be able to visit the page.

Read full topic
